page.title: 03CHILDHOOD THEN
page.content: In the olden days children went to school in what is now the Art Centre. One of the pupils, Mr Cheesman spoke to us. The school day was 9 o'clock to 12 o'clock and then 1.15 to 4 o'clock and everyone went home for lunch.In school time they did maths, mental arithmetic English,singing,geography and history. There were 7 classes with about 30 children in each class.There were 8 teachers,one for each class and the Head Master.They had to teach the children about everything,they did not have any specialist teachers. All the children from Cranleigh walked to school but others from out_lying farms came by horse_drawn cart. For a special outing they took the train to the seaside and were back for tea. We cannot do this now!
